fr_ours: Improves energy production efficiency in molten carbonate fuel cells by recycling excess hydrogen for reuse.
fr_competitor: Reduces excessive carbon dioxide emissions in hydrocarbon cracking systems during olefin production by converting methane into electricity and utilizing it in various applications.
tu_ours: Uses a system of fuel cell and separation unit to recycle hydrogen-rich exhaust back to the anode inlet, increasing utilization beyond 70% to 75%.
tu_competitor: Uses a novel system consisting of a furnace, separators, and fuel cell to effectively separate and convert hydrogen-rich methane from secondary streams, thereby reducing carbon dioxide emissions.
sv_ours: Enables increased energy production and more efficient use of hydrogen, potentially contributing to product competitiveness in the renewable energy market.
sv_competitor: Supports compliance with current and future emission regulations by lowering overall carbon footprint in hydrocarbon cracking systems, potentially improving product competitiveness and market applicability in the chemical industry.
overall_reason: Our patent demonstrates a clear advantage in strategic value due to its potential to increase energy production efficiency and competitiveness in the renewable energy market. While both patents offer technical differentiation, our patent's focus on enhancing energy production sets it apart.
